glossary.shortDefinition: A set of properties of database transactions intended to guarantee data validity despite errors, power failures, and other mishaps.
An open-source data integration platform with 300+ connectors for syncing data from APIs, databases, and files to data warehouses and lakes.
A serverless, interactive analytics service built on open-source frameworks, supporting open-table and file formats.
A serverless, NoSQL, fully managed database with single-digit millisecond performance at any scale.
A cloud big data platform for running large-scale distributed data processing jobs, interactive SQL queries, and machine learning applications using open-source analytics frameworks.
A managed service for processing and analyzing real-time streaming data.
A fully managed, petabyte-scale cloud data warehouse service in the cloud.
Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) is an object storage service offering industry-leading scalability, data availability, security, and performance.
An open-source platform to programmatically author, schedule, and monitor workflows, commonly used for orchestrating data pipelines and ETL jobs.
A distributed event streaming platform used for building real-time data pipelines and streaming applications, handling trillions of events per day.
A unified analytics engine for large-scale data processing, providing high-level APIs for batch processing, streaming, machine learning, and graph computation.
A serverless data integration service that makes it easy to discover, prepare, and combine data for analytics, machine learning, and application development.
Identity and Access Management (IAM) securely manages access to AWS services and resources.
A service to set up, secure, and manage data lakes composed of data in Amazon S3.
A serverless, event-driven compute service that lets you run code for virtually any type of application or backend service without provisioning or managing servers.
Massively scalable and secure object storage for cloud-native workloads, archives, high-performance computing, and machine learning.
A fully managed NoSQL and relational database for modern app development.
A fully managed, serverless data integration service for building ETL, ELT, and data integration pipelines.
A big data streaming platform and event ingestion service.
A managed, full-spectrum, open-source analytics service in the cloud for enterprises.
A fully managed real-time analytics service designed to process millions of events per second.
An enterprise analytics service that brings together data integration, enterprise data warehousing, and big data analytics.
A theorem stating that a distributed data store can only guarantee two of the three: Consistency, Availability, and Partition Tolerance.
A technique for identifying and capturing changes made to data in a database, enabling real-time or near-real-time data replication to other systems.
A database management system that stores data in columns rather than rows, optimized for analytics.
A centralized inventory of data assets in an organization, providing metadata, documentation, search capabilities, and lineage to enable data discovery and governance.
Formal agreements between data producers and consumers that define the structure, semantics, and quality expectations of data, enabling reliable data collaboration.
A framework of policies, processes, and standards for managing data assets across an organization, ensuring data is secure, compliant, and properly used.
A centralized storage repository that holds vast amounts of raw data in its native format until needed for analysis, supporting structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.
The documentation and visualization of data as it flows from source to destination, showing transformations, dependencies, and ownership at each step.
A decentralized sociotechnical approach to sharing, accessing, and managing analytical data in complex and large-scale environments.
The process of creating a visual representation of data structures and relationships, defining how data is stored, organized, and accessed in databases and warehouses.
The ability to understand the health and state of data in your systems by monitoring data quality, freshness, volume, schema changes, and lineage in real-time.
The measure of how well data meets the requirements for its intended use, encompassing accuracy, completeness, consistency, timeliness, and validity.
A centralized repository designed to store, integrate, and analyze large volumes of structured data from multiple sources for business intelligence and reporting.
A unified data analytics platform that combines data engineering, data science, and machine learning on a lakehouse architecture, built on Apache Spark.
An open-source transformation tool that enables data analysts and engineers to transform data in their warehouse using SQL and software engineering best practices.
A data integration process that extracts data from source systems, transforms it into a suitable format, and loads it into a target data warehouse or database.
A fully managed data integration platform that automatically syncs data from hundreds of sources to data warehouses and lakes with minimal configuration.
A serverless, highly scalable, and cost-effective multi-cloud data warehouse designed for business agility.
A fully managed, wide-column and key-value NoSQL database service for large analytical and operational workloads.
A fully managed workflow orchestration service built on Apache Airflow.
Unified stream and batch data processing that's serverless, fast, and cost-effective.
A fully managed and highly scalable service for running Apache Spark, Apache Flink, Presto, and 30+ open source tools and frameworks.
A serverless execution environment for building and connecting cloud services.
A scalable, durable, and secure ingestion service for event streaming and analytics.
Managed, secure, and scalable object storage for all your unstructured data needs.
An open-source Python framework for defining, documenting, and validating data quality expectations against datasets in data pipelines.
A comprehensive family of data governance, risk, and compliance solutions.
The process of moving data from a data warehouse back into operational systems (SaaS tools) used for business.
A concept in data warehousing to manage how data that changes slowly over time is stored and tracked.
A cloud-native data warehouse platform that separates storage and compute, enabling elastic scaling and pay-per-use pricing.

comparisons.title: Apache Airflow vs Dagster
comparisons.shortVerdict: Airflow is the task-based standard. Dagster is the asset-based challenger that brings data awareness to the orchestration layer.

comparisons.title: Apache Airflow vs Prefect
comparisons.shortVerdict: Choose Airflow for huge enterprise systems where stability is paramount. Choose Prefect for modern Python stacks, dynamic workflows, and superior developer experience.

comparisons.title: Apache Kafka vs Redpanda
comparisons.shortVerdict: Kafka is the Java-based ecosystem king. Redpanda is the C++ drop-in replacement that is 10x faster and simpler to operations.

comparisons.title: dbt vs Dataform
comparisons.shortVerdict: dbt is the undisputed industry standard for analytics engineering. Dataform is a fantastic, free alternative specifically for BigQuery shops.

comparisons.title: Delta Lake vs Apache Iceberg
comparisons.shortVerdict: Delta Lake is the default for Databricks users. Apache Iceberg is winning the "Open Ecosystem" war with support from Snowflake, AWS, and Netflix.

comparisons.title: Fivetran vs Airbyte
comparisons.shortVerdict: Fivetran is the "Apple" of ELT‚Äîexpensive but it just works. Airbyte is the "Android/Linux"‚Äîopen, flexible, and ubiquitous.

comparisons.title: Snowflake vs Google BigQuery
comparisons.shortVerdict: Snowflake offers superior multi-cloud flexibility and zero-maintenance performance. BigQuery offers effortless serverless scaling and deep integration if you are already on Google Cloud.
